title: Ticket #6775: Errors in StartLog stemming from lack of standard universe in Debian 9
description:
When a condor_reconfig is issues on my execute nodes, this message appears in my StartLog: 

09/20/18 12:54:16 Got SIGHUP.  Re-reading config files.
09/20/18 12:54:16 History file rotation is enabled.
09/20/18 12:54:16   Maximum history file size is: 20971520 bytes
09/20/18 12:54:16   Number of rotated history files is: 2
09/20/18 12:54:16 my_popenv: Failed to exec in child, errno=2 (No such file or directory)
09/20/18 12:54:16 my_popenv failed
09/20/18 12:54:16 my_popenv: Failed to exec in child, errno=2 (No such file or directory)
09/20/18 12:54:16 Failed to execute /usr/sbin/condor_starter.std, ignoring

condor_config_val STARTER_STANDARD (this knob is undocumented!!!) reports /usr/sbin/condor_starter.std suggests that at least one reason these messages show up is the lack of standard universe for Debian 9 packages. The message does not show up on my remaining Debian 8 nodes.

Can the message be suppressed appropriately?
remarks:
2018-Sep-20 13:02:12 by tpdownes:
The multiple my_popenv suggest that maybe multiple file I/O problems are occurring.

2019-Apr-10 15:21:09 by pfc:
Tim, is this easy to fix? If so, can we knock it off? If not, I'm willing to defer it.

2019-Apr-24 12:56:28 by gthain:
We made a change in 8.8 so at least the error message now shows what, exactly is failing to be popened.

We've also made the commitment to remove standard universe completely soon, so I'm going to mark this abandoned.
creator: tpdownes
